sentence.Network_en: Europe, with Germany literally and figuratively at its centre, is still at the start of a remarkable transformation.
sentence.Network_cn: 以德国作为地理以及比喻意义上的中心的欧洲仍处于巨大变革的初期。

sentence.Network_en: Figuratively, he could not kiss the hand that smote him.
sentence.Network_cn: 打个比方说, 他是不能认敌为友.

sentence.Network_en: Figuratively, one may imagine the radiation of such a spherical maser as resembling a little hedgehog.
sentence.Network_cn: 可以很形象地把这种球状脉塞源的辐射想象为一个小刺猬球的样子.

entry.def: If you use a word or expression in a figurative sense, you use it with a more abstract or imaginative meaning than its ordinary literal one.

example.ex: ...an event that will change your route — in both the literal and figurative sense.
example.tran: 一个无论从字面还是比喻意义上来说都将改变你的路线的事件

entry.def: Figurative art is a style of art in which people and things are shown in a realistic way.

example.ex: His career spanned some 50 years and encompassed both abstract and figurative painting.
example.tran: 他的职业生涯延续了大约50年，作品既有抽象画也有写实画。

auth_sentence.content: This should be a no-brainer both figuratively and literally!
auth_sentence.res_content: This should be a no-brainer both figuratively and literally!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This should be a no-brainer both figuratively and literally!

auth_sentence.content: He literally and figuratively can't take her in.
auth_sentence.res_content: He literally and figuratively can't take her in.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He literally and figuratively can't take her in.

auth_sentence.content: Figuratively, it's raining cats and dogs.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Figuratively, it's raining cats and dogs.

Sentence.sentence: It is figuratively and literally otherworldly in its aims.
